title: Two activities - Via ferrata and canyoning, both fantastic!
text:
Adam and I completed both the via ferrata and canyoning with Billy and Costino.
They are fantastic and knowledgeable guides. You will never feel unsafe but your will feel the adrenaline!
The via ferrata is extreme, a high and tough terrain but it's well worth it. You'll feel a sense of achievement.
We did the dry canyon, the rappells where high, how we like them.
I'm not gonna lie, I hurt. Two days of hard physical activity but I feel good for it.
This company does many other activities so just ask them. Great communication with Nicki.

title: Fantastic food, great TripAdvisor find
text: Great food, tasty, quick and very reasonable. We found this on TripAdvisor and the reviews are correct. We really enjoyed it.

title: The reviews are correct, excellent hamam!
text:
We had the Ali Mama which was great value at â‚¬45 each. The facilities are fantastic, hygiene is superb throughout the spa and the staff are lovely.
I came out feeling like a new person, relaxed, refreshed and very clean.
Book a place especially after a walking trip or hot day.
Communication with the spa was easy and quick.

title: Good hotel, very reasonable, average area.
text:
I found this hotel to be clean with a good shower which is as must for me. Bedding clean and I can't fault the hotel.
Breakfast was basic but plentiful.
I didn't realise the area it is in and the comments are negative about the area.
I've travelled all over the world and I didn't find it to be particularly unsafe. I didn't go in into the main area as the hotel is near the metro. We walked everywhere (my son and I). We weren't approached or asked for money by anyone. I'm always aware of my surroundings and it felt like Le Rambla in Barcelona on a night time, a bit run.
My advice would be to keep to the main streets as we did. Be careful of the gallery side walks as you would everywhere.
I'd book here again easily.

title: Great find, be sure to visit when in Athens
text:
We'd been walking past this restaurant for several days before we had lunch here. Should have gone there sooner!
The pork and chicken souvlaki were the best we'd had whilst in Greece. Tasty, plenty of meat and salad and super value. The wine was cheap and very drinkable.

title: Disappointed, I felt we were ripped off.
text:
It's hard to write a negative review but I was really disappointed with the service and therefore the meal we received.
I ordered chicken skewers or souvlaki but it came with 3 skewers instead of four as advertised, no salad or fries and I was still charged the same price.
My son found his meal tasty and it did come with fries.
Asked for chips and cheese and received fries and sauce. All I can say is that I felt we were treated differently and rushed.
All the other service we have received has been supurb in Greece but I wouldn't recommend here.

title: Beautiful, tasty food at very reasonable price, super find!
text:
Found through TripAdvisor and the reviews are spot on.
The found was delicious and generous. I don't like to describe food as simple as I think it doesn't recognise the chefs skills. So the food is flavoursome and uncomplicated (if it's on the plate, it's necessary).
Very reasonable in price and the staff were good. Please go, you won't be disappointed.

title: Good food, great service
text: Stopped to look and not hassled. Liked it immediately. Food was tasty, the teenager loved the shrimps. Wine was plenty, delicious and reasonable. Service was outstanding and welcoming, would definitely recommend
place: Pame Tsipouro Pame Kafeneio - 31 Aiolou str.

title: Impressed with this accidental find
text:
We both enjoyed this temple and building complex site. Walk freely amongst the ruins and enjoy the story of this area.
For people under 25, take id for free entrance.

title: Expectations did not meet reality
text:
Unfortunately, the expectation did not meet the reality. Although beautiful you were unable to go near the buildings (yes I understand conservation) but you were unable to connect.
As UK citizen, we support the return of stolen cultural artifacts from Greece and the Acropolis buildings from the British Library.

title: Our pizza was delicious.....
text: Our pizza was delicious. Really glad we chose to come here. Really tasty, thin pizza with fresh ingredients. Would easily recommend.

title: Beautiful house and gardens.
text: I visited after seeing someone else's pictures. It is a truly beautiful place, the house and gardens. We enjoyed the various sculptures within the gardens. A fantastic idea and great setting to display.

title: The fish is simply wonderful...
text:
A small wait but we'll worth it. This is a popular restaurant for a reason.
Garlic shrimp were simple and delicious. The monkfish and sea bass were tasty and large in portion. Very good value for money.

title: Fantastic pizzas and cocktails, worth a visit.
text:
Visit here twice as so good. Pizzas are large and delicious. Made with fresh product, straight from the stone oven.
Service was good and no issue with time.
Cocktails are reasonable on price and good serving and alcohol content.

title: Super tasty pizza and quick service.
text:
After travelling all day, we stopped to order a pizza from here. The review are correct, the pizzas are super tasty and fresh.
Good value, large in size and quick service.

title: We enjoyed our stay here at Pension Zeder
text:
Close to Bolzano and easy to get too, our room was spacious, super clean and had a beautiful mountain view.
Breakfast was plentiful, fresh and change daily so variety.
There was plenty of parking and the swimming pool and gardens were very well maintained.

title: Nice surprise find, good food.
text: We stopped here after taking a quick peek at others meals. We weren't disappointed. My beef was good well, my partners pasta was tasty and the wine was reasonably and drinkable. A lovely meal and would have returned if it had been open on a Sunday.

title: We got to tunnel 12, we'd go back to explore the others
text:
After seeing these tunnels on a Discovery programme, we wanted to go and explore. Make sure you have plenty of time as we ran out of time.
There are some fun tunnels to explore with off shoots on some. Take a torch if you can and wear good footwear as some tunnels are slippery and wet.

title: Via Ferrata in the Dolomites - fantastic and scary all at the same time!
text:
Randomly came across Rich through Facebook Bigtime Aventura. After messaging him, turned out he was in the Dolomites. He kindly agreed to be a guide for a via ferrata, making sure of our experience and what experience we were looking for and to achieve.
Fantastic, easy guy to get on with, who'll give you confidence to push your limits.
Rich does hut to hut hiking, climbing, canyooning and more activities. His passion really rubs off on you, inspiring you.
If your looking for a fun, exciting, adrenaline pact day, book Rich! It's guaranteed.

title: Simply fascinating
text:
I was surprised to discover Otzi in Bolzano and wanted to go after remembering his discovery.
The museum is informative with English, Italian and German information boards.
Although I felt sad for him being displayed. His equipment and belongings have been preserved and are remarkable both in technology but people's clear understanding of their environment and equipment for survival. It's truly amazing and I felt humble to realise, this individual had more knowledge than what we hold now, with all our 'technology'. Great place to visit.

title: Fantastic museum, surprised at variety of the museum.
text:
We thought a couple of hours would be needed to visit this museum but we're surprised at the quality of various exhibitions.
Interesting mountaineering history information, the history of the building and surrounding area which was fascinating.
Art installations and display items all within the beautiful castle. The building has been restored and blended with modern materials which are balanced to each other. The architectural design is fantastic and is very well throughout.
So 5 hours later and after visiting the cafe, we can highly recommend this museum.

title: Fantastic trial for hiking or bike.
text:
Completed this with a teenager. He enjoyed it! (miracle for a teenager). Well maintained, plenty of places to stop and rest and good signage.
We began at Sutton in Hull and cycled the 11 miles each way.
Free parking in Sutton, use HU4 7PD for parking.
No shops on way so take plenty your own food and drinks, have fun :-)

title: Beautiful handcrafted pizzas
text:
As title says, we had 2 beautiful handcrafted pizzas. Quality ingredients, thin base (how we like it) and delicious. A great find in these times.
Booked slot required and social distancing observed. Full recommendation given.

title: Interesting Local Museum with a great surprise!
text: Popped here on an off chance and loved the local museum. There is an exceptional artifact there (go see for yourself) which really demonstrates the local history and ongoing settlement of the area.

title: Fabulous meal and lovely atmosphere.
text:
Went as a group, reading some of the reviews we did not find what we exacted.
Service from staff was friendly and very accommodating. Food was delicious, tasty and piping hot (as I like it). All four meals were perfect. We will be back as I couldn't fit in a very fine looking raspberry and white chocolate cheesecake.

title: Great food and service.
text: Food was delicious, tasty and well presented. Service was good and would easily return and recommend.

title: Hidden gem that's free and with a tour
text:
Having no knowledge of the early settlers of Utah, this tour was informative and the house is beautiful. Full of interesting pieces of furniture of the time, the guides were able to provide some interesting facts and stories about Jacob and his wives.
If you love quilting, there are original quilts here which are well preserved.
Great for a hour and if your in the area

title: A real ghost town, worth the scenic drive
text:
Read about this town between Rockville and Virgin. Airy surroundings and the ability to go into the buildings made this an authentic experience.
Spooky in the basement of one building but that's why we all go!

title: So tasty, unbelievably good.
text:
We recommend this truck and just happened to pass it coming back from LA old zoo. Pulled up, order and 10 mins later, the best tacos, burritos and some other items I've ever had!
Small queue but I know why, simply delicious. Visit!!

title: Hired bikes and off we rode.
text: Loved this bike ride along the people. Only had a few bear misses with ignorant pedestrians! Clean, easy and fabulous views. Worth the day out of LA to visit.

title: Dirty and unpleasant in some areas
text:
I'm a seasoned travel and I meet many people. I found some of the conmen on the walk quiet aggressive.
This place wasn't for me unfortunately.

title: I am converted, simply the best!
text: We are now the best in n out burger fans. Tasty and fresh, we gave in in Las Vegas and haven't looked back we even have the T shirt lol

title: Macabre in capital letters!
text:
Fascinating both factually and disturbing manner. Being from the UK I've never been exposed to such graphic images but they have context and are respectful.
Would recommend this musean if you fancy an alternative experience. Many different information sections, we easily spent several hours here.

title: Two states for one bridge and a great view.
text: The marvel of this piece of engineering must be appreciated hence stopping by. Take water with you as hot in the open. We admired the view for 30 mins and went on our way.

title: Beautiful and compact.
text:
This was on our tour itinerary. Beautiful place, the display we saw was intricate with flowers and a great concept.
Worth a visit if you have a hour.

title: The best (and most alcoholic) Margaritas on the Strip
text: So hot we had to stop. Super surprised to find a Margarita Slushy. Sampled several on the strip and these are the best value and alcohol content. Enjoy!

title: Unbelievable, Neon heaven
text:
I think I could visit this museum over and over. The pieces of neon are exquisite and displayed throughout the outdoor gallery/Park.
We went in the dark as this was our preference but day viewing are available.

title: First visit, impressed and will be back!
text:
Off the cuff visit and was not disappointed. Beautiful fresh ingredients, cooked in an open wood oven. Simple and delicious.
This is a small and intimate venue but that's its charm. Same with the menu but fantastic authentic quality pizzas.
My son has had Napoli's pizzas from around the world, this one made the top 5.

title: Charming National Trust property with lots of character
text:
Surprise visit to this treasure. Although closing down for the winter cleaning season, the tour around the property was fascinating. Behind the scene look at conservation and areas that the public would not normally see (secret staircase). The guide was knowledgeable and enthusiastic.
We will be back for a house tour as its such a pretty property with nice grounds.

title: Fabulous way to spend an afternoon getting to know the city
text:
Annet made this a funny, interesting and great afternoon. A combination of great tour guide and good bike company created a fantastic tour. Malaga is beautiful and you'll see and visit many sites, Annet's personality is vibrant and adds extra colour.
Definitely a must, the biking is not difficult, easy/beginner. Go and enjoy this beautiful city.
place: Malaga Bike Tours & Rentals by Kay Farrell

title: It's either they don't know.....
text: .... They don't show, or they don't care about what's going on in the hood. Let me start by saying- 75 dollars each seems a bit much for a tour, but when you compare it to other excursions on offer its actually not a bad price. As a youth I'd seen the films Boyz n the hood & menace to society, and honestly never thought I'd get a chance to check out the locations or even drive through Compton. The tour operators use their knowledge of the areas they grew up in and connections to make that possible. Our guide was billy broham, and props to Billy as in my opinion he totally made the tour. Billy used to be a resident so is well versed in the area and very knowledgeable and gives valuable insight not only of the movie locations but how the places have changed over the years. I would recommend without hesitation the hood life tour.

title: This ain't no ghost town!
text: I entrusted the wife to find me a decent ghost town,....... She came up with this tripe.....id rather stick my head in a blender. On a more serious note, this is not an authentic ghost town (well, unless you count the four or five original houses), its a reproduction built in the 1950s. The best way to describe it, if you're English is the old American adventure park in Derbyshire that closed down in the nineties, but with no log flume or roller-coaster and a metric ton more gift shops. I feel this place would be better marketed as a theme town rather than a ghost town.

title: Would go again and again the food it that good!
text:
Trying to find somewhere to eat on a Sunday, this was one of the few places but I was luckily surprised.
Both orders were large, tasty and delicious. Service was super and patient with order (so much on the menu its hard to decide!)
Well worth a visit, you won't leave disappointed.

title: Food tasty but atmosphere and service was average
text: Food was tasty and plenty of it. Service was average and not particularly courteous. Was expecting a better experience.

title: Interesting museum and houses.
text: We were shown around several house museums from the period of settlement 1906 onwards. It was fascinating both in information, period pieces and the gentleman who told us additional information and stories into hurricanes social history. Loved every minute of this visit.

title: As good as the reviews say!
text:
Needing something to eat urgently, a TripAdvisor search later and map, we found the Pizza Wagon in Hurricane.
Thin, woodstove base with fresh, tasty toppings. Help yourself to drinks and cooked with 10 mins.
Beautiful 14" of pizza, we'd easily go back for another.

title: Great find, food is delicious
text: Happened to find this accidentally but very pleased. Food was tasty and generous, we had the stack sandwich and chilli fries. Could have ordered again as enjoyed so much.

title: Great find, comfortable and clean
text:
Expectedly good, the suite was clean, comfortable with all appliances needed.
Breakfast was simple but plenty. Could not ask for from for the price.
Additionally, shuttle to strip was on time and quick.

title: fantastic buffet, great choices
text:
Reading reviews this seemed like a good option but the food was extensively better than expected.
Tasty, no fat, all the dishes I tried I throughly enjoyed. Would easily go back and drinks are included.

title: Fastinating and gory all in one!
text:
A fastinating museum which easily takes a few hours to look around although you won't notice. As a novice, knowing very little about the mafia and organised crime. This museum provides an explanation throughout the years. Great artifacts, pictures and interaction.
Bring a jacket, as English the air was too cold for us.

title: Amazing find, a must eat.
text: A gem on Fremount St, beautiful food. Noodles were fragrant and tasty. The satay sauce was smooth and velvety.

title: Dark, scary and enthralling, everything a ghost tours should be!
text:
Simply the best ghost tour I've experienced. Back on at the last minute and not disappointed.
Mr Dreadful gave an insightful, fascinating and detailed series of accounts of haunted places around Sheffield.
Fantastic value for money, best Â£5 I've spent for an activity.
I will be attending again I was so impressed

title: Great adventure day out
text: Malc is a great instructor with a good sense of humour. Rock climbing and abseiling with the teenager (quality time). Malc was clear in directions and gave good encouragement. Very fortunate to be with a fantastic group, we really enjoyed ourselves.

title: Amazing place to go! Said a 14 year old
text:
Whilst attempting to interact with my teenager, we visit here. Individual, duo and multi player games which were all accessible and not long queue or waiting to play.
Spent over 4 years here and managed to interact and communicate with the teenager so would definitely recommend!!
Purchased Groupon voucher so excellent value too.

title: Set the kids free!
text:
Great place to set them free, running and jumping! The park has a larger play area than on previous visit and a great new splash area, suitable for all ages.
Get an annual pass and visit as ma y times as you like within the year.
Negative point, car park extra cost thanks to North lincs.

title: Wild hen do, cock... Tails galore
text: The cocktails are amazing, the establishment has great staff and atmosphere. Would highly recommend for drinks and food.

title: Interesting Trust castle
text:
Journey to the castle and local area is unusual as over the causeway (make sure your on your way before 3pm as causeway will be covered).
This doesn't feel like a castle in the typical sense but interesting to look around and very nice local area.

title: Fantastic hosts, bar, beer and wine and comfy beds, everything you need!
text:
This establishment has everything you need! Kirsty and Lee are fantastic hosts, breakfast (fresh eggs) and dinner are delicious and the rooms are clean, bright and airy.
On site bar to open soon so all you need for a relaxing French holiday.

title: Fun street art workshop, a must try for all ages!
text:
Purchased on Groupon, we really enjoyed the 2 hour workshop. Experimented with various techniques and sprays, everyone was encouraging and wanted you to develop your own particular style. Great place for creativity and fantastic art pieces on show and for sale.
Would definitely recommend for all ages.

title: Good job we didn't pay to get in!
text:
I found this place terrible. No sense of art to be found. Manic, frenzied and no possibility to enjoy the pieces.
Go to Shoreditch, you'll find fantastic art without the fuss.

title: Fantastic Street Art tour
text: Tommy really knew the area and art work. Saw some great pieces and knowledge understanding of the Shoreditch area. Fantastic vibe, would highly recommend.

title: Plenty to see and do.
text:
Another great National Trust venue. We with a teenager and even he enjoyed it!
Staff were knowledgeable, friendly and showed the machinery working to allow you a glimce into how the mill would have operated.
We loved the engineering aspect of this place but plenty of activities for smaller children. Beautiful grounds, great for running and jumping!
Advice would be to book beforehand to visit one of the houses. I will return, I'm sure it'll be lovely in the summer.

title: Would recommend hiring a bike from here!
text:
Good quality bikes which are very reasonably priced for hire.
Hire for the day at a cost of â‚¬15.
Staff were very helpful and printed off maps for self guided route and throughly explained route highlighting points to avoid.
Very pleased with service provided.

title: Natural geological wonder
text:
A geological wonder of the island, this volcanic tube system is well preserved and glorious in details to the activity which once occurred. I've visited other systems but this is one is not only larger but has an informative tour in both Spanish and English.
If you go after 3:30 you'll receive a discount on entry fee.

title: A quirky interesting museum
text:
Decided to go here on an off chance as struggling for activities. Fantastic quirky museum which was free and offered a good experience for an hour.
Full of information, you are easily taken back to the beginning of the early tourist adventure.
place: Museo AeronÃ¡utico del Aeropuerto de Lanzarote

title: Magical place... Beautiful house and gardens.
text:
Last minute decision to visit the hall but was overwhelmed by the houses beauty and magical presence. The architecture of the building is original and a delight to view. Moving from room to room gives a sense of the development of the houses over many years and generations.
Although winter, the outside was nice to walk around with lovely gardens and statues and novelties.

title: Fantastic B&B....
text: Great location near restaurants and pubs, beautiful room with all amenities and house. Very pleased with our stay, super comfortable bed and delicious breakfast in the morning. Would highly recommend.

title: Ice cream heaven!
text: Recommended by a local restaurant, all 3 of us agreed the ice creams we chose were delicious. Good amount for price, 150 varieties so all tastes catered for. Also the option for pastries and deserts. Just heaven...

title: Beautiful piazza
text: Beautiful piazza, nice to walk around and people watch. Beautiful fountains, each different in style.

title: Fantastic pizza and pasta
text: Found this restaurant accidently but a great surprise. Fantastic tasting pizza and pasta. Would highly recommend and good service. Would return if we had the time.

title: Always fun, always value for money
text: 3rd times we've been here to Arial Trail. Always fun and the kids enjoy the course everytime. Great value for money and I've purchased the activity on Groupon which makes it extra value when compared to other rope courses. Highly recommend and staff are fantastic.

title: The knights Templar were the special forces of their day!
text: Great little find in the wilds of Lincolnshire. Although only one tower survives, some lovely features held within. For myself, the graffiti brings the past into the present. Many before and many more to come and wonder at the structure and the presence the Knights Templar held.
place: Temple Bruer - Knights Templar Church Ruin
placeLocation: Ashby de la Launde, United Kingdom

title: Hidden gem in Lincolnshire
text:
This has been my favourite National Trust property out of the many I and the family have visited. Beautiful gardens with many seats to enjoy the views of the colourful and well set out gardens.
I found two difference with the house when looking around, I never met such enthusiastic volunteer guides. Speaking to one lady, who brought to life the family and tales of their lives, adventures and questionable behaviours. But also the house feels lived in and loved, the gentleman playing the piano was wonderful, bringing the room to life with music and knowledgeable. A fabulous day.

title: Beautiful Gatehouse and ruins but I'm bias!
text:
I simply never bore of the gatehouse and grounds (including ruins of abbey).
The gatehouse retains many features and is great for exploring with the children.
Walk with the sheep to reach the abbey ruins which still hold a sense of the original building. The kids loved the space and a great picnic area.
Although rural, I feel this English Heritage is one of the better visiting sites and worth a visit. I feel it holds a presence of history within it.

title: Great discovery
text: Bring a touch for the entrance tunnel. Accessed by either way after the bridge over the ford. Beautiful open quarry, great for exploring. Care needs to be taken on wet slate but felt safe when we explored. Park car at top of the lane or pub and walk down

title: Via Ferrata climb
text: The scenery from the Via Ferrata was stunning. Guides were excellent and activity was good although we expected it to be more challenging after past experiences. Would still recommend.

title: Fabulous food at a great price!
text:
10 of us arrived (without booking) and we were made to feel welcome and seated.
Let the house choose and we had a banquet! Beautiful mixed starters cold and hot (salads, fries and cheese, garlic bread). Main of meats and vegetables. In total 136 Lev for food and drinks. Great quality at a bargain price. One regret, not finding it sooner.
